title: Grade 3
subject: Essential Elements for English Language Arts (2024-)

document.title: Iowa Academic Standards Essential Elements for English Languange Arts

EB6A1CEBEFEF4C25A72D7EFCC611EB1F.description:
Demonstrate understanding of words that
signal spatial and temporal relationships (e.g., behind,
under, after, soon, next, later).

78512CB469514676B37BDDC32BC564F7.description:
Identify words that describe personal emotional
states.

154CAF3CBB2D428AA3FCE087302FFCB7.description:
Identify real-life connections between words and
their use (e.g., happy: “I am happy.”).

E0DE2B6A0D41429787E213B31302B050.description:
Determine the literal meaning of words and
phrases in context.

29519B67371A4ECEA12C9416BA79CC08.description:
Demonstrate understanding of word relationships
and use.

7A615132D1C24AB5A5A43B7CD1ECCFBC.description:
With guidance and support, identify the temporal
meaning of words when common affixes (-ing, -ed)
are added to common verbs.

515A8C85009F436594B4DB906C090AFF.description:
With guidance and support, use sentence level
context to determine what word is missing from a
sentence read aloud.

4F63C1B5CB05446884039A051D0D6FB9.description:
Use language to make simple requests, comment,
or share information.

1963C55DF242418299699B21FCE75969.description:
Use language to achieve desired outcomes when
communicating.

B4C1DCFD03F74ACEAC0785079EAE55BA.description:
Consult print in the environment to support reading
and spelling.

94E6A3891F004AB89BA37F54289BE62F.description:
Use spelling patterns in familiar words with
common spelling patterns to spell words with the
same spelling pattern.

077BD8D3FA8941B1A12A3ED599FC1DCE.description: Use resources as needed to spell common highfrequency words accurately.

3878FC9D2D3D49738F37C4A9887EE475.description:
During shared writing, indicate the need to add a
period at the end of a sentence.

09BB9184671E40B4B95048584D99C138.description: Capitalize the first letter of familiar names.

33502FAF5A044079AEB6254633D4F538.description:
Demonstrate understanding of conventions of
standard English.

2D01746AA70C41AE90E54D1550E80C70.description: Use present and past tense verbs.

9FCE6F1FC6F54A4E940839F93A5719F5.description: Use regular plural nouns in communication.

65873396B6A843B9B015D4923365B53F.description:
Uses noun + verb, noun + adjective, and subject +
verb + object combinations in communication.

DFE1495D4B744AEF9EEDE6632104C3EB.description:
Demonstrate standard English grammar and
usage when communicating.

9F5A910535AF4DEBB034E822842E73AA.description:
Combine words for effective communication to
clarify thoughts, feelings, and ideas in various contexts.

4D1B3943838944EC90B813B09E2B383E.description:
Create a multimedia presentation of a story or
poem.

0AFBE3C88FCD476290CF792ED257FDEF.description:
Recount a personal experience, story, or topic
including details.

BA63F12E91AB49AFAEFDF349F2DD3F66.description:
Ask or answer questions about the details
provided by the speaker.

9284FE020AEF49AF8748491254A86D9D.description:
Identify details in a text read aloud or
information presented orally or through other media.

55787A40D26F4976B0846D34A606B1E2.description:
Indicate confusion or lack of understanding about
information presented.

A1275AEB2AE54671A0B1F28DC9C4994E.description: Listen to others’ ideas before responding.

4ED36244677D470C83DAF86FE33CB307.description: Engage in collaborative interactions about texts.

9FAF229CE5BA4E64B96E5823CA4BFD43.description:
Write routinely for a variety of tasks, purposes,
and audiences.

DDD8DF79F67546CDAC69D2C3621D4AA7.description:
Sort information on a topic or personal
experience into two provided categories and write about
each one.

3795FE35E02141E889A40EC22ADE8164.description:
Identify information about a topic for a research
project.

DAE0C4B94DB44E61931E1933E78AADFA.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

957A3B31A86045DEA67C9A7F692AC4B1.description:
With guidance and support from adults, use
technology to produce writing while interacting and
collaborating with others.

3329812BDB0A4915ACB3295011E8A01E.description:
With guidance and support from adults and
peers, revise own writing.

FC6AC2A7EBD3424BBC9C434F3F236B1D.description:
With guidance and support, produce writing that
expresses more than one idea.

D3F208CD9D7846FAA5AADADB9BD7AEDB.description:
Select an event or personal experience and write
about it including the names of people involved.

8752E2EE98244F46AEE961509CB8E1D0.description: Write about events or personal experiences.

9A1CF04106AF48679CD9F66D912A78AD.description:
Select a topic and write about it including one fact
or detail.

A7F6ED999D53415AA701C792CA1777EB.description: Write to share information supported by details.

E0305D31C1794DB689A3A9BD7399C699.description:
Write one reason to support an opinion about a
text.

D26FBB027217458EBF18A9BF7D0F4A38.description: Select a text and write an opinion about it.

5D575918F70847B8BCB5295209BB6792.description: Write opinions about topics or text.

A1F77FBAC2084D079912AD4856788B11.description:
Use context to determine missing words in familiar
texts.

085247E5884B48F195A642DDF369197C.description: Read familiar text comprised of known words.

FC9254B3A83E47B5A753B0E5FE3DDE23.description:
With models and supports, decode single-syllable
words with common spelling patterns (consonantvowel-consonant [CVC] or high-frequency rimes).

28F6CF0B69684B8EB434720CB7AA9507.description: In context, demonstrate basic knowledge of lettersound correspondences.

34588941CBD1431CACF34B715BF6E0F9.description: Use letter-sound knowledge to read words.

23389EEA9F294E7EA32B1D4C32B01106.description: Reading and Writing Standards: Foundational Skills

23CCFB1F57DE42E69DBDF4132634A0B1.description:
Demonstrate understanding of text while
actively engaged in shared reading of history/social
studies, science, and technical texts.

721F8EB7C9894F9CA5E7E70A761A8294.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

A5523E9C2E8D44C1B3E28815CA3A5993.description:
Identify similarities between two texts on the
same topic.

DAA4A16F4156419DAB343E1384B29DFE.description:
Identify two related points the author makes in an
informational text.

B65F3F271AD443BDA1EDAAA33F01B0B7.description:
Use information gained from visual elements and
words in the text to answer explicit who and what
questions.

ACCFFF6E1DD84836AAAB38C745767539.description: Identify personal point of view about a text.

08677F32DF3D43288B776246FE196A4E.description:
With guidance and support, use text features
including headings and key words to locate information in a
text.

353C1C4D482C4DE694042D3B520DBC16.description:
Determine words and phrases that complete
literal sentences in a text.

D5620298C69A4700A218B0B24A7BEC49.description: Order two events from a text as “first” and “next.”

00DF4588205B4CFABDCE00EE6BCAE57D.description:
Answer who and what questions to demonstrate
understanding of details in a text.

78C6986B74EB4067BA0F3C194C6893BC.description:
Demonstrate understanding while actively
engaged in shared reading of stories, dramas, and poetry.

B25C8546DEAE4B2C99C9245C624AD5CB.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

F6EC5EBCE04E464381EAB6935FEEBC33.description:
Identify common elements in two stories in a
series.

AFD2F5525C61434BBC416B43FBE305F4.description:
Identify parts of illustrations or tactual
information that depicts a particular setting, or event.

00B7B38D81414DD6992E875D9DBBC9F5.description: Identify personal point of view about a text.

34A06E923527423C8E45F7F64DBCF9AD.description:
Determine the beginning, middle, and end of a
familiar story with a logical order.

551C2735FD0140879EA514722A486D21.description:
Determine words and phrases that complete
literal sentences in a text.

1C4F5DA334204D5192C50A0E0C6AFDE1.description: Identify the feelings of characters in a story.

230B14F9EE2146C780C17B459F0FF72A.description:
Associate details with events in stories from
diverse cultures.

8D8A2FF469AC4D3EAC40D7C1284E565F.description:
Answer who and what questions to demonstrate
understanding of details in a text.
